title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Quizzes A romantic restaurant, World Cup tickets, and some Patriots-adjacent baked goods are all part of this week’s news quiz.
Brian Walshe enters the courtroom for his trial for murdering his wife Ana, Thursday, Dec.
4, 2025, in Dedham, Mass.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins gave Oilers ‘too much respect’ out on TD Garden ice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "That's the one thing.
I wished we got a little bit out of our comfort [zone] a little bit and pushed a little bit harder.
" Marco Sturm and the Bruins came up short against the Oilers on Thursday.

title: Man suspected of Brown University shooting, MIT professor slaying found dead in N.H. storage facility, authorities say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime A 48-year-old man was behind both the Brown University shooting that killed two and injured nine and the killing of an MIT professor in Brookline, officials said Thursday night.
He took his own life in Salem, N.
H.

title: Gloucester man convicted of beating fellow inmate to death at Bridgewater facility in 2021
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man was found guilty of manslaughter Wednesday after he was initially indicted on a second-degree murder charge in 2021.
A Gloucester man was convicted of beating another inmate to death while they were incarcerated at Massachusetts Treatment Center in 2021.

Blake Nissen/The Boston Globe A Gloucester man was found guilty of manslaughter Wednesday after he beat another inmate to death while incarcerated at a state prison in 2021, according to court records.

title: Disney World considers dynamic pricing that could drive ticket prices higher
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Tell Us “It’s not dynamic pricing as much as it is dynamic ratcheting.
" Crowds fill Main Street USA in front of Cinderella Castle at the Magic Kingdom on the 50th anniversary of Walt Disney World, in Lake Buena Vista, Fla.
, on Oct.

title: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court to take up White Stadium case
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News A judge ruled in favor of the city's White Stadium plan earlier this year, but opponents appealed the decision.
A view of the former White Stadium in Franklin Park in early August 2025.
Danielle Parhizkaran/Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: The MBTA is testing a new Charlie Card, but it’s missing something — or rather, someone
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Transportation His fate is still unlearned.
A newly-designed Charlie Card will interact with the new card readers.
New fare collection readers are being tested on MBTA buses, place at all doors.

title: Author Stephen King recalls Rob Reiner in heartfelt tribute
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Celebs "I surprised the hell out of myself by giving him a hug.
" Actor and director Rob Reiner (right) is pictured as he talks to Red Sox season ticket holder and author Stephen King (left) before a game on June 16.

title: Local obituary: Ella Cook, 19, Brown University sophomore and Alabama native
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Local Obituaries "She had a love for piano, dance, spending time outdoors in Hale County, and traveling anywhere — especially where French is spoken!
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Ella Cook.

title: Drake Maye is excited by his next prime time opportunity
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots "That's what we're trying to play for many years down the road.
Trying to be the team that people want to see at night, and people want to see when the only game on is us.
" The Patriots beat the Giants 33-15 in their last prime time game, on Dec.
